title: 2. IRRI Agronomy Challenge 2: Transplanting Day (20 December 2012)

tasks.task: Using a machine for transplanting crops
subtasks: Understanding the benefits of machine transplanting over manual methods
Considering labor shortages and the adoption of technology in Asian agriculture
Recognizing the machine's origin and its spread from Japan, Korea, and China to India
Acknowledging the business opportunities for small farmers and women in seedling production
Ensuring uniform growth of seedlings in mats
Precise handling and cutting of seedlings into strips for machine feeding
Navigating the machine through muddy conditions
Addressing challenges such as engine failures and mechanical issues
Adjusting to the physical demands of walking alongside the machine
Managing seedling loss in particularly wet or muddy patches

tasks.task: Evaluating the success of machine transplanting
subtasks: Observing the final spacing and growth potential of transplanted seedlings
